title: Developing Ethical Judgment and Practical Wisdom in Online Education

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening ethical decision-making competencies for aspiring elementary education professionals in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain five types of ethical dilemmas that may occur in online learning environments
Learners can design procedures for making ethical decisions in immediate educational settings by applying the concept of practical wisdom (phronesis)
Learners can apply three core ethical principles—privacy protection, fairness maintenance, and relationship-building—in digital environments to real-world scenarios
Learners can analyze potential conflict situations during online interactions among teachers, students, and parents and propose resolution strategies
Learners can independently develop a toolkit supporting ethical decision-making in LMS-based learning environments

resources: Case database on digital educational ethics
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
